message.content:
Step 1: Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet, total liabilities are given by:
 Accounts Payable = 450,000.00
 Taxes Payable = 278,279.50  
 Total Liabilities = 450,000.00 + 278,279.50 = 728,279.50
• Total Assets (end amount) = 14,823,650.85
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 728,279.50 / 14,823,650.85 ≈ 0.0492  
Rounded to two decimal places, this is approximately 0.05.

Step 2: Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• From the income statement:
 Gross Profit = 2,545,589.48
 Total Revenue = 5,565,589.48
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100  
= (2,545,589.48 / 5,565,589.48) × 100 ≈ 45.76%

Step 3: Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement:
 Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = -81,548.37
• And from the balance sheet, Total Current Liabilities = 728,279.50  
• Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities / Total Current Liabilities  
= -81,548.37 / 728,279.50 ≈ -0.112  
Rounded to two decimal places, this is approximately -0.11.

Thus, the final answers in the required JSON format are:

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.05",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "45.76%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-0.11"
  }
}
